content.body: The existing statement _“Function expressions in JavaScript are not hoisted”_ in MDN is correct, right?
content.formatted_body: The existing statement “Function expressions in JavaScript are not hoisted” in MDN is correct, right?

content.body:
correct.

```
console.log(foo) // ReferenceError
void function foo() {}
```
Functions expressions do not need to be hosted because their binding is only visible inside their body, and no code can run before that binding initialization.
I dislike @[Ashley Claymore]'s example, because swapping the two statements doesn't remove the error
content.formatted_body: I dislike @[Ashley Claymore]'s example, because swapping the two statements doesn't remove the error
